title: Acknowledgment - NYPD
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        Your request has been assigned to {{ user.title }} {{ user.last_name }} ({{ user.formatted_point_of_contact_number }}) of this office. Before a determination can be rendered, further review is necessary to assess the potential applicability of exemptions set forth in FOIL, and whether the records can be located. I estimate that this review will be completed, and a determination issued {% if days %} within {{ days }} business days of this letter{% else %} on {{ moment(response_due_date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }}{% endif %}.

        This is not a denial of the records you requested. Should your request be denied in whole or in part, you will then be advised in writing of the reason for any denial, and the name and address of the Records Access Appeals Officer.

title: Denied - Refer to Court
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        In regard to the document(s) which you requested, I am unable to provide access to these records, for these records are not in the possession, custody or control of this Department. It appears the information you seek may be available from the Court of original jurisdiction.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. Please include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.

title: Denied - Endanger (ยง82(2)(f))
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        In regard to the documents(s) which you requested. I must deny access to these records on the basis of Public Officers Law Section 87(2)(f) as such records/information would endanger the life or safely of witnesses.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. Please include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.

title: Denied - Interrogatory
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        The Freedom of information Law allows access to documents reasonably described, not answers to interrogatories. Therefore, I am unable to process your request.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. Please include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.

title: Denied - Not Reasonably Described
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        The Freedom of Information Law allows access to existing documents and does not necessitate the creation of a document. I am unable to provide access to these documents on the basis that your request does not reasonably describe a record in a manner that would enable a search to be conducted by the New York City Police Department.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. title: Denied - 50a
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        In regard to the documents(s) which you requested, I must deny access to these records on the basis of Public Officers Law Section 87(2)(e) and Public Officers Law 87(2)(a), in that such records consist of Police Officer's personnel records and are therefore exempt from disclosure under the provisions of Civil Rights Law Section 50-a.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. Please include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.

title: Denied - Sealed Record
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        I must deny access to the records you requested on the basis of Public Officers Law Section 87(2)(a). These records are sealed under court order, pursuant to Criminal Procedure Law Section 160.50 and can only be requested by the arrested person or their representative.

        In order to release these records, this unit must receive a notarized affidavit from the arrested person or their representative within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter, addressed to the attention of {{ user.title }} {{ user.last_name }} ({{ user.formatted_point_of_contact_number }}), who has been assigned to handle your case. Failure to do so will result in this file being CLOSED.

        You must notify this unit of any changes to address. Failure to do so will render this unit unable to give you the document(s) you requested.

title: Denied - 50b
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        The documents you requested are protected under section 50(b) of the New York Civil Rights Law, it is therefore necessary to deny access to these records. In order to release these records, this unit must receive a notarized affidavit from the victim, within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter, addressed to the attention of {{ user.title }} {{ user.last_name }} ({{ user.formatted_point_of_contact_number }}), who has been assigned to handle your case. Failure to do so will result in this file being CLOSED. You must notify this unit of any change of address. Failure to do so will render this unit unable to give you the documents(s) you requested.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. Please include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.

title: Denied - Unreadable

A copy of your correspondence will be kept on file with this office. It has been assigned file # {{ request_id }}. Please send us a legible version of your correspondence so that we can respond accordingly.

title: Denied - Active Judicial (ยง87(2)(e)(i))
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        In regard to the document(s) which you requested, I must deny access to these records on the basis of Public Officers Law Section 87(2)(e)(i) as such records/information, if disclosed would interfere with law enforcement investigations or judicial proceedings.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. content:

title: Denied - Kingsland Letter
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        At this time I must deny your request. The facility that houses the records you seek sustained severe damage during Hurricane Sandy, therefore, the requisite search for such records is precluded at the current time. However, this denial will not act to prejudice any future request you may make for the same records once the facility becomes accessible.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. Please include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.

title: Closed - CIS Letter
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This letter is in further response to your letter dated {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to NYPD records of an accident investigation pursuant to the N.Y. Public Officers Law ยง 84 et seq., also known as the Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL").

        Because you and/or your client have demonstrated that you have an interest in the subject accident, ยง66-a of the Public Officers Law, rather than FOIL, governs the extent of disclosure that is available to you, and affords you greater access than could be obtained under FOIL.

        Accordingly, the records that you requested are enclosed.

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. Please include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.

title: Closed - CIS Determination Letter
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This letter is in further response to your letter dated {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to NYPD records of an accident investigation pursuant to the N.Y. Public Officers Law ยง 84 et seq., also known as the Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL").

        Because you and/or your client have demonstrated that you have an interest in the subject accident, ยง66-a of the Public Officers Law, rather than FOIL, governs the extent of disclosure that is available to you, and affords you greater access than could be obtained under FOIL.

    In total, _____ page(s) have been accessed
    The requested documents are enclosed with this letter.
    The case folder contained records that did not directly pertain to the accident.
    _____ CD/DVD-ROM(s) have been copied.
    The case folder contained records that did not directly pertain to the accident. Such records are not included in the enclosed CD/DVD-ROM.
    Please remit payment in the amount of $__________. Once payment is received, I will send you your requested document(s) and/or CD/DVD-ROM(s)
PAYMENT PROCEDURE
Send check or money order (no cash) payable to the "New York City Police Department"
Mail payment to:
New York Police Department, F.O.I.L. Unit, Room 110C, One Police Plaza, New York, NY 10038
Note: Please include the FOIL number on the check or money order
APPEAL PROCEDURE
Should you so desire, you may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing, within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter, and must be forwarded to:
Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York, NY 10038
Pl or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.orgease include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.

title: Extended - CIS
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        Before a determination can be rendered, further review is necessary to assess the potential applicability of exemptions set forth in FOIIL, and whether the records can be located. I estimate that this review will be completed, and a determination issued by {{ moment(due_date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }}. As your request seeks the disclosure of accident records, you may be granted access to these records under POL ยง66-a, by contacting the NYPD's Collision Investigation Squad (CIS) directly. If you would like to contact CIS directly, I have enclosed forms PD 301-162 and PD 301-165, which should be completed in accordance with the instructions provided therein and submitted to the address stated on each form.

        If you choose to pursue your request under FOIL, please notify this office within 30 days of the date of this letter. If you fail to do so, your FOIL request will be deemed closed. This is not a denial of the records you requested. Should your request be denied in whole or in part, you will then be advised in writing of the reason for any denial, and the name and address of the Records Access Appeals Officer.

title: Extended - 2nd Letter
content:

        Your request has been assigned to {{ user.title }} {{ user.last_name }} ({{ user.formatted_point_of_contact_number }}). I estimate that the processing of your request will be completed by {{ moment(due_date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }}. The estimated time required to determine your request is based on the following factor(s):

        Record(s) are located in several locations and are difficult to search or locate.
        Records are archived and are difficult to locate and retrieve.
        Numerous records must be reviewed in order to determine whether disclosure is required.
        Record(s) have not yet been received from other NYPD unit(s).
        Request is extremely voluminous and/or complex.
        Other:

        This is not a denial of the records you requested. Should your request be denied in whole or in part, you will then be advised in writing of the reason for any denial, and of the name and address of the Records Access Appeals Officer.

title: E-Mail
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        An Email that you sent to the New York City Police Department has been forwarded to this unit for a response. Your E-Mail requests access to records that may be in the possession of the New York City Police Department. To facilitate a proper response to your request, a Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request form is enclosed. Please fill out the form with as much information as you have regarding the records you are requesting. Upon our receipt of the completed form a search for such records must be conducted. If records responsive to your request are located, such records must be reviewed to assess the applicability of any particular exemptions from disclosure set forth in FOIL. title: Denied - BWC Exemption
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        Pursuant to an order by the Appellate Division First Judicial Department dated July 3, 2018, in the case of Patrolmen's Benevolent Association of the City of New York, Inc. v. Bill de Blasio in his official capacity as Mayor of the City of New York, James P. O'Neil in his official capacity as Commissioner of the City of New York Police Department, and New York City Police Department, Appelate Division of the Supreme Court of New York County, M-2522, M-2667, Index 150181/2018, the New York City Police Department is enjoined from releasing body camera footage absent compliance with N.Y. Civil Rights Law 50-a.

        If there is a need for body camera footage while the stay is in effect, one should, on notice, petition either a Justice of the Supreme Court or the Appellate Division, requesting an order modifying the stay for a particular video(s).

        You may appeal this decision or any portion thereof. Such an appeal must be made in writing within thirty (30) days of the date of this letter and must be forwarded to: Sergeant Jordan S. Mazur, Records Access Appeals Officer, New York City Police Department, One Police Plaza, Room 1406, New York. NY 10038 or emailed to foilappeals@nypd.org. Please include copies of the FOIL request and this letter with your appeal.
